00007   Dominic Mazzoni
00008 
00009   VU Meter, for displaying recording/playback level
00010 
00011   This is a bunch of common code that can display many different
00012   forms of VU meters and other displays.

00026 // Increase this when we add support for multichannel meters
00027 // (most of the code is already there)
00028 const int kMaxMeterBars = 2;
00029 
00030 struct MeterBar {
00031    bool   vert;
00032    wxRect r;
00033    float  peak;
00034    float  rms;
00035    float  peakHold;
00036    double peakHoldTime;
00037    wxRect rClip;
00038    bool   clipping;
00039    int    tailPeakCount;
00040    float  peakPeakHold;
00041 };
00042 
00043 class MeterUpdateMsg
00044 {
00045    public:
00046    int numFrames;
00047    float peak[kMaxMeterBars];
00048    float rms[kMaxMeterBars];
00049    bool clipping[kMaxMeterBars];
00050    int headPeakCount[kMaxMeterBars];
00051    int tailPeakCount[kMaxMeterBars];
00052 
00053    /* neither constructor nor destructor do anything */
00054    MeterUpdateMsg() { };
00055    ~MeterUpdateMsg() { };
00056    /* for debugging purposes, printing the values out is really handy */
00058    wxString toString();
00060    wxString toStringIfClipped();
00061 };
00062 
00063 // Thread-safe queue of update messages
00064 class MeterUpdateQueue
00065 {
00066  public:
00067    MeterUpdateQueue(int maxLen);
00068    ~MeterUpdateQueue();
00069 
00070    bool Put(MeterUpdateMsg &msg);
00071    bool Get(MeterUpdateMsg &msg);
00072 
00073    void Clear();
00074 
00075  private:
00076    int              mStart;
00077    int              mEnd;
00078    int              mBufferSize;
00079    MeterUpdateMsg  *mBuffer;
00080 };
